two little feet the preparations introduction knitting socks was one of my first forays into knitting and will always have a special place in my heart i ve knitted them for all of my family including new additions long before i had a child of my own back then i found it difficult to find instructions that included all the information i needed as a well-meaning knitter with absolutely no clue how big a baby foot was and while it s been quite a few years since then i still haven t seen many sock patterns that would have satisfied my needs back then this pattern is my attempt to give others the pattern that i wished for i have included sizes ranging from very small preemies to around 8 years of age as sizes for older kids start to overlap with women s sizes this pattern will produce a very stretchy children s sock the socks are knitted in a traditional top-down approach using a heel flap with slipped stitches that makes the heel a bit more cushioned and hard-wearing and gusset shaping for the instep both the waffle texture and the special cast-on where chosen to make sure the socks have a lot of give and the toes are grafted to avoid hard edges in general the socks will accommodate quite a bit of growth in width but you may want to pay closer attention to the intended recipient s foot length if possible techniques used knitting and purling knitting in the round knitting back and
